document.title: UNRAVELING THE INEQUITABLE NATURE OF THE MODEL MINORITY: ASIAN-AMERICANS DESERVE AFFIRMATIVE ACTION

author.institution: St. John's University School of Law

document.publication-title: Tennessee Journal of Race, Gender, & Social Justice

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: 2017 Candidate for Juris Doctor, St. John’s University School of Law; B.A., University of San Diego, 2012. I would like to thank my instructor Professor Cheryl Wade, for teaching a course entitled “Issues of Race and Gender in the Law” at St. John’s. I also extend my special thanks to my entire family for your unwavering support in my continued successes. Finally, I thank my mother, Chris Arcitio, and grandmother, Mila Hanson, who give me the strength to shoot for the stars.
